quality.title: I adhere to the “Quality in Translation” campaign. The following requirements apply for every project I accept:
quality.one: I strive for the best possible translation every time.
quality.two: I only accept assignments that allow me to strive for this goal.
quality.three: I only work into French and Spanish, my native languages.
quality.four: I only accept assignments in my fields of specialization.
quality.five: I constantly strive to improve through constructive feedback and ongoing training.

works.title: Translation/proofreading process

security.title: Data security
security.text: Upon request, I can set up a password-protected FTP server for sending and receiving your documents. I back up all my translations and keep password-protected copies until my clients have received them. All documents are kept confidential.

proofreading.title: Proofreading by another translator
proofreading.text: Upon request, I can include proofreading as an additional service in my non-binding offer. A second qualified translator, i.e. a trusted colleague of mine, will then proofread the translation.

works.one: Select the documents that need translation.
works.two: Contact me via my contact form, by email or phone and provide first details about your project, such as the deadline, type of texts, target audience etc.
works.three: After our first contact, send me the texts that you would like to be translated.
works.four: I will analyse these texts and prepare a non-binding offer for you taking into account the specific details you gave me, such as the deadline, target audience etc.
works.five: I will send you my non-binding offer and specify a deadline by which you will have to either accept or decline my offer.
works.six: Upon confirmation, I will translate or proofread your documents and send them back to you until the given deadline. My translation process includes quality assurance. I proof all documents twice and run a quality assurance check for technical translations, such as Xbench.
works.seven: You confirm that you have received the translated documents and that the documents meet your standards and specific requests.
works.eight: I will send you my invoice by the end of the month. Every invoice is due within 30 days from the date of invoice.

about.first: My name is Jessica Regnault. As a graduate in law from the University of La Laguna and professional translator for more than 3 years, I believe in the power of language and how it forms our perception of the world around us.
about.second: With more than 2,000,000 words translated in technical and legal fields, I will help you successfully communicate with your partners, clients, and suppliers in France and Spain. Tell me what you want to say. I will find the right words.
